clinical_study.brief_title: Necklace-Shaped Sensor for Non-Invasive Monitoring of Stroke Volume and Cardiac Output
clinical_study.official_title: Necklace-Shaped Sensor for Non-Invasive Monitoring of Stroke Volume, Cardiac Output, Fluids, Heart Rate, Heart Rate Variability, and Respiration Rate

brief_summary.textblock: Study will compare measurements made with Necklace device for stroke volume/cardiac output with values from a FDA-approved reference device. The gold standard that will be used is Cardiac MRI. Subjects will be measured with both the Necklace, reference device, and the Cardiac MRI. Values calculated by the Cardiac MRI analysis will be compared with the reference device and the Necklace.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study will compare measurements made with Necklace device for stroke volume/cardiac output with values from a FDA-approved reference device. The gold standard that will be used is Cardiac MRI. Subjects will be measured with both the Necklace, reference device, and the Cardiac MRI. Values calculated by the Cardiac MRI analysis will be compared with the reference device and the Necklace.
The Cardiac MRI will be received ~1-4 days after the measurement is completed. The data will be compared with data collected from the Necklace and the reference device during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Stroke Volume Measurement from Necklace with Cardiac MRI measurement of Stroke Volume
primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective up to 6 months after study completion

arm_group.description: Accepting both healthy and non-healthy subjects. A portion of the subjects will have a fluid management issue or heart failure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be able to undergo Cardiac MRI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Sensitivity to electrodes
